response:
Urgent neuroimaging is required to visualize the pontine pathology and differentiate between a mass lesion, active demyelination, and ischaemia. Comprehensive blood, CSF, and autoimmune screening is necessary to identify the underlying etiology.

investigations = ["MRI Brain with contrast", "MRI Angiogram of intracranial vessels", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Blood glucose", "HbA1c", "Anti-AQP4 antibodies", "Anti-MOG antibodies", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ANCA)", "Lumbar puncture for CSF analysis"]
